spec.name: Mohammed V high school
spec.description: Mohammed V High School (Lycée Mohammed V) is one of Casablanca's most historically significant and prominent educational institutions, with its main building constructed between 1922 and 1954. It was designed by architects **Isaac Lévy and Elie Azagury**. The complex represents the monumental public architecture of the Protectorate era, blending early Art Deco with functional design. Named after King Mohammed V (Sultan Mohammed Ben Youssef), it became a symbol of national pride after independence and was declared a **National Material Patrimony** site in 2004.
